title: Frontend Developer
description:
**️ What We Do**  

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.


With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

**Who We Are**  

Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.


At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.


To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Frontend Developer.

**‍ About The Role:**  

The Partner Platform serves as our interface with our partners, offering insights into their flexible energy assets and illustrating their contributions to the energy system. As an early member of this newly formed squad, you will play a pivotal role in shaping both the product and our team’s culture and ways of working. Your contributions will significantly impact how our partners perceive Flower and our services.

**What You’ll Do:**  



* Learn about the green energy transition and get a deep understanding of Flower’s offering
* Collaborate closely with the Product Designer, Product Owner, Full-stack developers and Data Engineer
* Develop and maintain the frontend of our web portal built in React, NestJS etc
* Realize new user flows and implement crisp designs from Figma
* Contribute to stable and scalable solutions
* Contribute in discussions about architecture, design and user needs
* Visualize complex data, showcasing Flower’s flexibility services to our Partners
Work with new features connected to internationalization, diversification of our portfolio of assets (renewable energy production and storage) and new data streams  
* 

**Who You Are:**

  

* You find it meaningful to contribute to Flower’s mission
* You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent documented experience
* You have at least four years of industry experience in web development
* You have experience of building system from scratch or early on
* You have strong frontend programming skills, specifically in React
* You are familiar with backend frameworks such as Nest.js, Spring, or Django
* You have experience building responsive web applications
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and mindset
You have strong communication and collaboration abilities  
* 

**Location**  

Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from the old town and Slussen subway stations. We value office collaboration but support hybrid work.


**️ Apply**  

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the **Talent Acquisition Specialist, Talent Acquisition Specialist, Developers from the team, Head of Partner Platform, and our CEO John.**


Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.


We look forward to hearing from you!  



-

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.  

  

**Jobbeskrivning**  

Inledningsvis kommer uppdraget bestå av att hjälpa den nya förvaltningen att komma igång med förvaltningsarbetet vid införandet av webbpubliceringssystem Sitevision. Uppgifterna kan exempelvis bestå av att göra utvecklad kod mer förvaltningsbar och proaktivt verka för att underlätta förvaltningen av exempelvis hemsidan samt vårt intranät som kommer köras i Sitevision. Stöttning till andra förvaltningar och utvecklingsteam kan vara aktuellt vid behov, för att exempelvis utveckla webbtjänster till hemsidan.



Linux används som målmiljö för utvecklingen av system. Merparten av systemutvecklingen sker i frontend med hjälp av javascript, då främst i React, css och andra webbtekniker. För vår backend-utveckling använder vi främst Java, men även flera andra tekniker.



Vårt utvecklingsteam använder agila metoder för att planera, genomföra och följa upp arbetet.


Utvecklingsarbetet sker nära beställare/produktägare och andra utvecklare i teamen, ibland med flera parallella tjänster och produkter på gång samtidigt.
  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet, under de senaste 3 åren, av att ha implementerat webbpubliceringssystemet Sitevision och ha god förståelse för hur det är uppbyggt och hur det driftas
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta i Linuxmiljö
* minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av webbutveckling med javascript och css
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling med React.
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av backend-utveckling med Java
* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete i agila team.
* obehindrat behärska svenska flytande i både tal och skrift, samt ha goda kunskaper såväl muntligt som skriftligt i engelska.

  

**Meriterande**  

  

* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet och god kännedom av att utveckla system med höga krav på tillgänglighet och prestanda. Tjänsterna är igång 24/7 med snabba svarstider
* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet och god kännedom av plug-in-utveckling i Sitevision
* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet och god kännedom av att utforma webbtjänster som är tillgänglighetsanpassade enligt WCAG standard.
* arbetslivserfarenhet och god förståelse för NoSQL-databaser som exempelvis Cassandra.
* arbetslivserfarenhet och god förståelse för Keycloak- integration med Sitevision
* arbetslivserfarenhet och god förståelse för LDAP och Active Directory

 **Sista ansökningdatum:** 29-10-2024

 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårnodsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: C++ Utvecklare
description:
Vi på Knowit har funnits i Örebro under flera år och växer nu ytterligare med Knowit Connectivity. Vi söker nu en erfaren C++-utvecklare som vill vara en del av vårt växande team. Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med avancerad teknik, vara med och forma vår verksamhet och bidra till vår framgångsrika expansion i regionen.


**Om rollen**


Som C++-utvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med tekniskt utmanande projekt inom en rad olika branscher, från inbyggda system till realtidssystem. Du blir en del av ett starkt team av specialister där innovation, samarbete och problemlösning står i centrum. Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för utveckling och vill bidra till att stärka Knowits position som en ledande aktör inom systemutveckling.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i C/C++.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom datateknik, IT, systemvetenskap, maskinteknik eller liknande.
* Ett intresse för tekniskt avancerade projekt och problemlösning.
* God kommunikationsförmåga och vana att samarbeta i team.

**Meriterande erfarenheter:**


* **Linux**: Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Linux-baserade utvecklingsmiljöer.
* **Qt**: Erfarenhet av utveckling med Qt-ramverket.
* **Inbyggda system**: Erfarenhet av utveckling för inbyggda system.
* **Realtidssystem**: Kunskap om realtidsprogrammering och dess specifika krav.

**Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som är självgående, ansvarstagande och har en stark analytisk förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad och kan snabbt anpassa dig efter kundernas behov. Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är ett stort plus då du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder och deras specifika utmaningar. Som en del av vårt team bidrar du med din expertis samtidigt som du fortsätter att utvecklas i din yrkesroll.


**Varför** Knowit Örebro?


Knowit Connectivity i Örebro är nystartat, och du får möjligheten att vara med från början i ett dynamiskt och växande team. Vi erbjuder en kreativ arbetsmiljö där du får utrymme att påverka och forma framtiden för både dig själv och vårt bolag. Samtidigt som vi har en lokal närvaro i Örebro, har du kraften av en stor organisation i ryggen med över 4000 specialister i Sverige och Norden.


Hos oss får du:


* Arbeta med spännande projekt och teknik.
* Vara en del av ett jämställt team där innovation och samarbete står i fokus.
* Professionell utveckling genom kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och nya utmaningar.
* Flexibla arbetstider och en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv.

**Låt oss bygga framtiden tillsammans!**


Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill vara med på vår tillväxtresa i Örebro, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Ready for something different? Are you an experienced and passionate full stack developer looking for the next challenge in your career? If you would like to combine the benefits of working as a consultant with the benefits of working in a product company, we at Piktiv would like to hear from you!**

##### **Who We Are**


We are a progressive consultancy company that provides smart solutions for our clients. Our work spans from heavy industry systems, healthcare applications, retail and fintech systems, to computer games. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and our ability to turn complex challenges into streamlined solutions.


In contrast to many other consultancy companies, Piktiv brings in client projects to work on in-house by providing highly skilled fullstack teams instead of individual consultants. At the moment we are looking to add more team members to our largest client — a global leader in the retail forex industry, which is the largest financial market in the world.

##### **Who You Are**


You have accumulated years of in-depth experience in software development. Your approach to problem-solving is both creative and practical, ensuring that the solutions you develop are technically sound. Your ability to communicate effectively is paramount, allowing you to translate complex technical concepts into understandable terms, and fostering client trust and understanding. This skill enhances your ability to align technical solutions with the client’s business needs, allowing you to exceed their expectations.You are not just a developer but a leader within your team.


Your experience positions you as a mentor to junior colleagues, helping them to grow and excel in their roles. Your ability to guide, inspire, and improve the team dynamic is as important as your technical skills.

##### **What you will do**


Working at Piktiv means being part of a cross functional team consisting of you and your Piktiv colleagues. Together you will tackle the tricky challenges that our clients face.

*Responsibilities*:

* Be involved in every step of the development process, from requirements gathering, design, and implementation to testing, deployment, and operations.
* Actively contribute to the development and evolution of our software solutions, leveraging your expertise to guide the project direction.
* Mentor and support your fellow developers, helping them grow their skills and knowledge. Your guidance will contribute to building a strong, skilled, and cohesive development team.

##### **Qualifications**

* At least 8 years of experience working as a software developer
* At least 4 years of professional Java experience
* Proficiency in at least one front end framework
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal

##### **Desirable skills**

* Proficiency in Spring Boot, Oracle Database, PL/SQL, DynamoDB, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience working with enterprise systems
* Experience working with financial systems

##### **What We Offer**


At Piktiv, we believe in the importance of open communication and creating a collaborative workplace where each individual can thrive. We work hard to cultivate a culture of support and learning with an emphasis on a healthy work-life balance. We offer a competitive salary as well as several perks and benefits. Rather than offer a standardized plan across the company, we like to tailor our offer to your personal preferences in person. The position is full-time, 40 hours per week, on-site in our Skövde office.

title: Mobile App Developer (Capacitor, iOS, Android)
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.*


You’re a Mobile App Developer who thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven, analytical and agile environment. Your soft skills shine and you can communicate with ease in English. You are passionate about technology, team work, but also have a responsibility and autonomy in your work. You are able to work efficiently in a remote work environment, in a setting where online and asynchronous communication is the foundation. You will be joining the Product team and working on the integration of the app with external temperature measuring devices.

 **What you will be doing**

* Ship top-quality, performant, accessible, inclusive user interfaces, features and products
* Work on the device integrations with the Natural Cycles core App (built as a Hybrid Web application, packaged for iOS and Android)
* Work in an agile team together with other software engineers, product manager, designers & testers
* Work in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization to deliver top-quality user interfaces and features
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics and if possible, always take the data driven approach
* Ensure continuous delivery of new releases while working in an agile way
* Maintain a healthy codebase

 **What skills and experience we think you have**

* Experience in mobile app development: building and maintaining iOS and Android applications
* Experience in frontend web/app development: building websites, web applications, responsive layout
* Experience with Swift and Kotlin
* Experience with TypeScript and frontend Javascript frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue
* Good understanding of modern CSS (e.g Flexbox, Grid), experience with modern pre/post-processors, such as SASS, PostCSS
* Experience working with git, github, pull requests, code review, etc.

 **Not required but it would be a bonus if you also have:**

* Experience with building software that integrates with connected devices (via Bluetooth, API etc)
* Experience with Node.js backend development
* A passion for women’s health

 **Our technology stack includes:**

* TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js running on GCP AppEngine
* Swift, Kotlin in our mobile apps
* Ionic, Angular, Capacitor, React, Gatsby on the Frontend
* Firebase Hosting
* Highly automated CI pipelines (Github Actions)
* AppStore/GooglePlay releases on a biweekly basis
* We <3 Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our general-purpose repositories

 **What we offer**

* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development

 **Location**


We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the *product development* team you will work with is located in Stockholm.  

  



  

**Sounds interesting?**


If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.


We look forward to hearing from you!

 **How to apply**


To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.


At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Flightradar24 is one of the most successful growth-stage tech companies in Stockholm. Each day more than 4 million aviation enthusiasts use our app or website and we have many of the biggest names in aviation as business customers.


We are looking for a talented iOS developer to join Flightradar24, further expanding the team working on the world’s most popular flight tracking app. You will play an important role in our mobile team, implementing new features, improving performance and modernizing our codebase. Above all, your work will impact the way millions of users experience Flightradar24 every day.


Note that this position requires that you are able to work in Stockholm, Sweden. Relocation is not offered for this role.  

**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Work alongside a team of 4 iOS developers and 4 Android developers
* Collaborate with the mobile team, including developers, designers, QA and our product owner, to find end-to-end solutions to important problems and features
* Contribute to development of features, refactoring and modernizing our app, and maintaining a high-quality codebase
* Deliver modern, testable and maintainable code adhering to best practices in iOS development
* Add to, and enhance, our comprehensive automated test suite
* Participate in knowledge sharing with the other developers in the team
* Coordinate releases of our iOS app, rotated within the team on a regular cycle

**Who you are**
---------------

* You have at least 4 years of professional iOS app development experience, preferably on apps with a large user base
* You have experience working with Swift
* You have strong experience with UIKit and SwiftUI
* You care about quality and know what it means to ship high-quality code
* You are passionate about iOS development and have an eagerness to learn
* You have strong experience with writing automated tests - including unit and snapshot tests
* You have prior experience with CI/CD tools
* You have strong attention to detail
* You have strong written and spoken English
* You have prior experience with Google Firebase, MapKit and/or StoreKit (desirable)
* You have the ability to read, understand and modify existing Objective-C code (desirable)

**About Flightradar24**
-----------------------


With over 4 million daily users, Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Our app regularly tops the App Store and Google Play Travel charts. We also offer a wide range of commercial services and our customers include many of the biggest names in aviation.

  

We're constantly adding new services and improving existing products. To help us meet those challenges, we're looking for creative, collaborative and tech-savvy applicants to join us.  

  



Benefits of working at Flightradar24 include:

* Opportunity to impact a service with millions of end users from all around the world
* Flexible and social work environment with free beverages, fruit, and snacks
* Modern office in the heart of beautiful downtown Stockholm, Sweden
* Being part of a diverse team with over 30 nationalities and 6 continents represented, with English being our main language

title: iOS Developer
description:
**Role:**

  

* Develop a well-architected, scalable, and high-performing iOS app.
* Define and support technical standards and best practices.
* Diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
* Ensure that applications meet required quality and security standards.
* Collaborate with other product teams to deliver an omnichannel retail experience.
* Provide expert-level knowledge of iOS platform best practices.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* Expertise in iOS app development.
* Expertise in Swift and SwiftUI.
* Experience in working with cross-functional teams.
* Knowledge of omnichannel retail environments.
* Proven ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
* Strong understanding of security and quality standards in app development.

**Following competences must be fulfilled:**

* Expert knowledge in iOS development and best practices.
* Ability to collaborate in a team environment.
* Experience in large-scale app deployment and performance optimization.
* Fluent in English.

**Additional Note:**  

We encourage all developers to broaden their expertise by supporting other platforms within our scope, including Android and .NET/Azure for backend development. Experience in these areas is a valuable asset that enhances team collaboration and project success.

 **Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Malmö  

**Period**: 01-01-2025-30-06-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 21-10-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**️ What We Do**  

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.


With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

**Who We Are**  

Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.


At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.


To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Fullstack Developer.

**‍ About The Role:**  

The Partner Platform serves as our interface with our partners, offering insights into their flexible energy assets and illustrating their contributions to the energy system. As an early member of this newly formed squad, you will play a pivotal role in shaping both the product and our team’s culture and ways of working. Your contributions will significantly impact how our partners perceive Flower and our services.

**What You’ll Do:**  



* Learn about the green energy transition and get a deep understanding of Flower’s offering
* Collaborate closely with the Product Designer, Product Owner, Data Engineer and other Full-stack developers
* Develop and maintain our web portal built in React, NestJS etc
* Contribute to stable and scalable solutions, using test frameworks
* Contribute in discussions about architecture, design and user needs
* Visualize complex data, showcasing Flower’s flexibility services to our Partners
* Work with new features connected to internationalization, diversification of our portfolio of assets and new data streams

**Who You Are:**  



* You find it meaningful to contribute to Flower’s mission
* You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent documented experience
* You have at least four years of industry experience in web development
* You have experience of building system from scratch or early on
* You have experience with a frontend framework like React, Vue, or Svelte
* You have experience with backend frameworks such as NestJS, Spring, or Django
* It is considered meriting if you have cloud experience at AWS Cloud Practitioner level or higher
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and mindset
You have strong communication and collaboration abilities  
* 

**Location**  

Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from the old town and Slussen subway stations. We value office collaboration but support hybrid work.


**️ Apply**  

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the **Talent Acquisition Specialist, Developers from the team, Head of Partner Platform, and our CEO John.**


Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.


We look forward to hearing from you!  



-

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Senior fullstack-utvecklare C#/React/React Native till...
description:
Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba med en produkt som påverkar miljoner svenskar i ett team av drivna och talangfulla människor.


laget.se är en av Sveriges största sajter med hundratusentals besökare varje månad varav över 200 000 personer använder vår app. Vi är väldigt stolta över att bidra till att göra vardagen som ledare, spelare, kanslist, styrelsemedlem och förälder i den svenska gräsrotsidrotten både enklare och roligare. Som vår vision säger, Fler i idrott!

### **Hur vi jobbar**

* Oavsett teknik så värdesätter vi samarbete högt. När vi jobbar tillsammans har vi roligare, lär oss mer, och får en mycket bättre produkt!
* Allt nytt bygger vi med .NET Core i backend och React för frontend.
* Vår app är byggd i React Native för att effektivt utveckla mot både iOS & Android.
* Tester är en viktig del av vår utvecklingsprocess.
* För lagring använder vi SQL server, MongoDB och ELK stacken.
* För att ha koll på vad vi gör använder vi bland annat Git, Grafana, Kibana och Miro.
* Vi är i en fas där vi nu uppdaterar vår produktstrategi för att ta oss ifrån vår gamla monolit byggd i ASP.NET MVC till Core API / React.
* Vi itererar ofta och vill ha så små leveranser som möjligt genom vårat CI/CD flöde.

### **Förväntningar på dig**

* Du har många års erfarenhet av utveckling och det är extra meriterande att ha jobbat med en digital produkt/SaaS-tjänst innan.
* Vi är ett litet team och du förväntas ta plats och kunna driva utveckling självständigt samtidigt som du också vill göra dina kollegor bättre.
* Du har jobbat i C# innan eller har så mycket erfarenhet att olika språk inte är ett hinder för dig att vara produktiv.
* Du är van med SQL och har jobbat med någon No-SQL databas också.

Du har erfarenhet av att jobba med meddelandeköer i en tjänsteorienterad arkitektur.  
* 
* Du anser personlig utveckling vara viktigt och tar ett stort eget ansvar kring att labba med nya ramverk och verktyg samt följa trender.
* Du älskar utmaningar och söker dig gärna till svårare problem.
* Du värdesätter detaljer, design och användbarhet.
* Du triggas av att jobba i team och värdesätter ett löpande kunskapsutbyte.
* Du tar ansvar och stöttar dina kollegor när det behövs.

### 
**Det lilla extra**

* 5 000 kr i friskvård
* 6 veckor semester
* Roliga aktiviteter med hela teamet
* Mobil med tillhörande abonnemang
* Ett hemtrevligt kontor mitt i Örebro med egen terrass
* Flexibilitet där remotearbete delar av veckan kan vara vardag


Vårt kontor är vårt andra hem och en plats som ofta skapar wow hos våra besökare. Det är en plats som inspirerar oss att hela tiden ta nästa steg men samtidigt njuta av vardagen, t.ex. med en GIS "Glass i soffan". Så gillar du att komma hemifrån har du alltid en kollega på kontoret.

### **Du får vara del av en resa**


Vi har stora planer på hur vi vill fortsätta driva utvecklingen av digitala verktyg inom svenskt föreningsliv. Med vår vision "Fler i idrott" har vi satt målet högt för vad vi kan hjälpa gräsrotsidrotten med. Vi söker dig som vill engagera dig i denna produktresa och på riktigt göra positiv impact på människors vardag.

### **Om laget.se**


Vi är ett värderingsstyrt produktutvecklingsbolag som hjälper Sveriges idrottsföreningar. Genom vår produkt förenklar vi vardagen för idrottsfamiljer. Våra medarbetare utgör alla en stor och viktig del i detta arbete. Oavsett roll, bakgrund och tidigare erfarenheter förenas vi alla i viljan att bidra till “Fler i idrott”.

### **Vårt medarbetarlöfte**

**På laget.se vill vi erbjuda våra medarbetare ett meningsfullt arbete.** Vi vill erbjuda en arbetsplats som du kan vara stolt över. Medan vi tillsammans bidrar till "Fler i idrott" ser vi också till att ha kul ihop både på och utanför arbetstid. Trots att vi är utspridda i landet arbetar vi hårt för att bibehålla den gemensamma lagkänslan och ha en tydlig riktning där alla hjälps åt.  

  

När vi frågar våra medarbetare vad de uppskattar mest med sin anställning nämner de den familjära stämningen, stimulerande arbetsuppgifter och en stor portion frihet under ansvar. Inte minst uppskattar dom att få arbeta nära idrotten och möjligheten att få göra skillnad på riktigt.  

  

*Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på laget.se* *här**.*

  

Varmt välkommen till oss på laget.se  



  

Per Stenmar  

CTO  

E-post: per.stenmar@laget.se  

Mobil: 0734-304636

title: Senior IT-utvecklare till Kvdbil
description:
**Kvdbil är Sveriges största marknadsplats för begagnade bilar, årligen säljer vi runt 26 000 bilar.** **När vi går till jobbet varje dag gör vi det med strävan om att jobba mot en schysstare bilbransch – med ärlighet och transparens. Vi drivs av att ge god service och hitta lösningar som underlättar våra kunders bilaffärer. Och kul på jobbet, det har vi mycket av!**


Nu söker vi en senior IT-utvecklare till vårt Bilpriser-team.

**Om jobbet**


Som IT-utvecklare på Kvdbil arbetar du huvudsakligen med att utveckla funktionalitet till något av Kvdbils IT-system. Vid sidan av detta ger du ett visst tekniskt stöd till organisationen inom ramen för affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling.


Bilprisers IT-landskap består idag huvudsakligen av applikationer i .NET 8 och .NET framework 4.8, som driftas på Azure. För front-end används Razor/Blazor.  

  

Över tid planerar vi att gå över till Python/Kubernetes/GCP och Typescript/React, som används av övriga delar av Kvdbil. Därför är det viktigt att du har ett aktivt intresse för olika programmeringsspråk, utvecklingsmetoder och -verktyg.


Vi erbjuder dig ett omväxlande arbete i en dynamisk organisation med ett stort mått av entreprenörskap, tillsammans med möjligheten att verkligen påverka utvecklingen av företagets IT-stöd.


Vi tror på vikten av samarbete i stort och smått, inte minst mellan IT och övrig verksamhet och för att driva utvecklingen framåt ger vi den enskilde medarbetaren stora möjligheter att fatta beslut i vardagen.

**Din profil**


Vi söker dig som har en bred teknisk kompetens, gärna med fokus på ovanstående system och programspråk. Du har goda analytiska och problemlösande förmågor och är också en god kommunikatör, samtidigt som du har förmåga att se helheten och har en grundläggande förståelse för arkitektur.


Vi ser även att du har ett engagemang för utveckling av affär och verksamhet samt en förmåga att visualisera, definiera och skapa lösningar.


Som person är du ansvarstagande och engagerad och vi lägger stort värde vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du gillar snabbt tempo och fart i utvecklingen för att kunna leverera nya funktioner i hög takt med hög kvalitet. Du gillar att ha roligt på jobbet och är social och kommunikativ.


Slutligen tror vi att du har en högskoleutbildning inom IT/systemvetenskap.

**Så är det att jobba på Kvdbil**


Hos oss är du expert på ditt område, men behöver inte vara bäst på allt. Du är en del av en organisation full med kunskap och kollegor som har din rygg när du behöver det. Här arbetar du under ett tillitsbaserat ledarskap bredvid kollegor med många olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter, åldersgrupper och personligheter.


**Väx med oss**


Vi är ett företag i ständig förändring där vi har snabba beslutsvägar med möjlighet att göra sin röst hörd och vara med och påverka. För dig som drivs av att ständigt kunna utvecklas och verka i en föränderlig vardag finns rum för att växa inom bolaget. Vi har många kollegor som gjort karriär internt och vuxit i både ansvar och expertis under åren.


Hos oss får du marknadsmässig lön, är anställd under kollektivavtal och får ta del av ett attraktivt förmånspaket med tillhörande försäkringar.  

  

**Övrigt**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som vi inleder med sex månaders provanställning. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.

**För frågor om tjänsten kontakta CIO Helena Spiess via mejl helena.spiess@kvdbil.se eller telefon 072-324 84 87.**

*Vi behandlar ansökningarna löpande, så sök tjänsten redan idag!*

 *Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen* ***”Skicka ansökan".*** *Ansökningar per e-post kan vi tyvärr inte beakta.*

*I den här rekryteringen har vi valt annonsering och kanaler och tackar därför vänligen men bestämt nej till direktkontakt med försäljare och rekryteringsföretag.*

*Urvalsarbetet kan kompletteras med personlighets- och logiktester och/eller bakgrundskontroll.* *Vi utför drogtest på slutkandidat innan avtal om anställning träffas.*

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
På NOBA leder vi utvecklingen av automatiserade kreditbeslut med en flexibel och skalbar plattform som effektiviserar kreditbedömningar för våra utlåningsprodukter. Vi söker en tekniskt skicklig person som vill samarbeta med våra kreditspecialister och analytiker för att driva innovation inom kreditriskhantering. Bli en del av vårt Credit Risk Engine-team – vi lär dig allt om kreditrisk inom bank och finans!

**Om rollen:**  

Som systemutvecklare i vårt Credit Risk Engine team kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i utvecklingen och förbättringen av vår kreditbeslutsplattform. Du kommer att delta i både dagligt genomförande av förändringar för att hantera kreditrisk och driva försäljning, samt bidra till långsiktiga strategiska mål. Denna position erbjuder en unik möjlighet att fördjupa din förståelse för kreditrisk och automatiserade beslutsystem.

**Huvudsakliga uppgifter:**

  

* Implementera och testa komplexa kreditregler med hjälp av vår designstudio, i nära samarbete med Kreditriskteamet.
* Utveckla och utöka kreditbeslutsplattformen med Python.
* Köra och analysera simuleringar för att optimera kreditstrategier.
* Säkerställa systemkvalitet genom att skriva tester i vårt automatiserade testframework.
* Stödja intressenter med felsökning av problem relaterade till kreditbeslut.

**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Utbildning inom kvantitativa ämnen (t.ex. matematik, statistik, datavetenskap eller liknande) krävs.
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat.
* Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling.
* Kunskaper i Python.
* Grundläggande SQL-kunskaper krävs.
* Stort intresse för att lära sig nya tekniker och metoder.


Det är ett plus om du även har:

* Erfarenhet av .NET, Java eller JavaScript är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av dataanalys

**För att trivas och prestera väl i rollen tror vi att du behöver vara:**

  

* Noggrann och ha ett kvalitets fokus i alla leveranser.
* Utmärkta färdigheter i tidsplanering och förmåga att möta deadlines.
* Kommunikativ och med förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för intressenter i verksamheten.

Utmärkta färdigheter i tidsplanering och förmåga att möta deadlines.  
* 

  

**Varför välja oss?**  

Som System Developer erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att arbeta i teknikens framkant inom automatisering av kreditbeslut, där du får bidra till att forma framtidens lösningar. Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att växa både professionellt och personligt, med kontinuerlig utveckling och spännande utmaningar. Du kommer att bli en del av en innovativ och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö, där idéer värderas och där du tillsammans med ett engagerat team driver utvecklingen framåt.

  

Utöver detta är det viktigt för oss att du känner igen dig i våra värderingar: vi är helhjärtade, vi samarbetar och vi tar ledningen.

 **Praktisk information:**  

Start: Omgående  

Plats: Gävlegatan 22, Stockholm  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidare (tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning)  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Arbetstider: 8.30-17 (jun-aug 08:30-16:00)

  


Ta chansen och följ med på en utvecklande resa med oss på banken med stort och snabba .  

  

Vi eftersträvar mångfald av kunskaper och erfarenheter bland våra anställda och välkomnar alla sökande med kvalifikationer för anställningen. Vi värnar om en rekrytering fri från diskriminering som ger lika möjligheter för alla.

 **Vad händer när du har skickat in din ansökan?**  

Antalet steg i rekryteringsprocessen kan variera beroende på vilken tjänst du sökt men vi försöker alltid att hålla processen så kort och koncis som möjligt, för att värna om din ansökningsupplevelse. Vanligtvis kan du förvänta dig två intervjuer innan referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Du kan läsa mer om hur vår rekryteringsprocess går till under FAQ.


Om du har några frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten så kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Rebecca Khan, rebecca.khan@nordax.se.  

  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!  

  



NOBA bank värnar om din integritet och vill, med hänvisning till GDPR, be dig att inte inkludera några känsliga personuppgifter i din ansökan. Exempel på känsliga personuppgifter kan vara information om etniskt ursprung, politiska åsikter, religiös övertygelse eller information om din hälsa, till exempel sjukskrivning.Har du skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig meddela detta till den rekryteringsansvarig som står angiven nedan så att vi kan hantera dina personuppgifter korrekt.

title: Educational Content Developer
description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming society. AI Sweden is the national centre for applied artificial intelligence, jointly funded by the Swedish government and our partners, both public and private. Our mission is to accelerate the use of AI for the benefit of our society, our competitiveness, and for everyone living in Sweden.

**We are now looking for an Educational Content Developer to further strengthen our Competence Team.**

### **About the position**


Shape the future of AI education with AI Sweden! We're looking for a passionate professional with expertise in competence development, instructional design, and AI content creation. Your role will involve leading the design and delivery of impactful AI training programs, from concept to evaluation, to make AI accessible to learners. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams, simplify complex concepts, and develop engaging educational experiences using various formats, including written and visual materials.

### **We believe that as a person you’re**

* Holding a degree in Education or a related field.
* Experienced in creating educational content, including using AI-powered tools.
* A strong communicator in both Swedish and English, able to engage with diverse professional groups.
* Adaptable, passionate, and collaborative, with the ability to work both independently and within a team.

### **And workwise, you’re**

* Skilled in project management with a deep understanding of AI and its applications in organizational development.
* Experienced in e-learning or digital platform development, and familiar with learning theories.
* Proficient in developing frameworks for competence development and delivering educational workshops (both in-person and online).
* Capable of measuring and optimizing learning programs based on evaluation data.
* Experienced in managing cross-functional teams and delivering projects from concept to execution.

### **Who we’re looking for**


To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better. Some of our colleagues are leading AI experts, but far from all of us are as technically well versed. You'll be working alongside journalists, linguists, policy professionals, leading AI-scientists, historians, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more.

### **Why work for AI Sweden?**


At AI Sweden, you’ll be part of a diverse and highly skilled team with inspiring colleagues all working with a higher purpose in mind than “just” tech.


As an organization, we’re uniquely positioned at the sweet spot of governmental oomph and startup nimbleness. Small enough to stay adaptive and have fun but backed by and in close contact with both state and industry, both private and public. A hybrid, just like you.


And, we can most certainly be a platform helping you realize your ideas. Bring a good one, big or small, and we most likely will support and co-create with you.


In short, we like to believe we offer our staff a place to grow, an environment for personal development.


Listen to Johanna, Vinutha, and Martin to hear what they say about working at AI Sweden.

### **An equal and fair working environment**


We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion and are acutely aware of the skewed gender balance in our industry. We actively strive to put together a diverse team in terms of age, gender and background.


Naturally, we’re under a collective agreement (“kollektivavtal”) and offer everything that comes with it in terms of annual leave, pensions, wellness allowance (“friskvårdsbidrag”), and such.


Application closes October 27th. If you have any questions or thoughts, don’t hesitate for a second to contact **Raquel Broman****, Head of Training**.

 *AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.*

title: Cloud RAN Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**


Are you ready to create the future of 5G?


In the control plane team within the Engineering Unit Cloud RAN, Product Engineering Unit vDU, our primary task is to systemize and implement the control plane functions in our vDU product with the overarching goal of maintaining Ericsson's leading position in the market. Our particular emphasis is on developing software for COTS HW and cloud environments.


We are currently seeking a Developer to join our outstanding team in Linköping. In this role, you will work on our Cloud RAN software product, playing a pivotal role in ensuring its success. Your work will have a big influence on our customer success and will be used by millions of people around the world.

  

Join us at the forefront of innovation!

 **What you will do**

* Participate in the enhancement of existing software features and the development of new ones, with a focus on optimizing scalability, performance and reliability by taking full advantage of the evolving architectural and services inherent to a Cloud Native Platform
* Design and review software based on requirement specifications for the CloudRAN software product using mainly C++ in a Linux environment
* Create automated tests in multiple layers for the software you and your team write
* Participate as a dedicated team member in everyday teamwork and collaborate closely with your colleagues in a global environment
* Work end-to-end; participate in pre-design activities, document your work, and follow your work all the way to customer activities
* Handle customer feedback and fix bugs
* Analyze, design, and implement product improvements to secure long-term quality and architecture for our software products

 **The skills you bring**

* Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++ or Java and object-oriented programming(/design)
* A university education in e.g. M.Sc/B.Sc in computer science/IT/electrical engineering or equivalent experience
* An ability to communicate effectively in written and verbal English
* Good communication skills and a positive team-oriented attitude
* Familiarity or interest in cloud technology
* An interest in developing your personal qualities and deepening your knowledge and career with us
* Knowledge in Telecommunication, Machine Learning and Agile ways of working is beneficial

 **Application**  

Last day to apply: October 30, 2024. Position is based in Linköping, Sweden.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Linköping

**Req ID:** 755739

**Recruiter:** Miroslaw Cos
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**Job Requirements**  

**Senior Full Stack Developer**


We are looking for a **Senior Full Stack Developer - with more than 8+ years of experience**. The ideal candidate will be an experienced independent contributor, comfortable working in an Agile environment, and proficient in both **frontend** and **backend** development. The role requires translating business requirements into scalable, high-quality software solutions and participating in the full development lifecycle. Experience with retails company would be a plus.


This role is ideal for a senior developer passionate about full-stack development, DevOps practices, and working in a collaborative, Agile environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Full Stack Development**: Build and maintain a coworker tool for configuring price recommendations, as well as the backend APIs supporting it.
* **DevOps**: Embrace a DevOps culture of **"We build it, we run it, we own it"** by managing development, deployment, and post-production tasks.
* **Collaboration**: Actively engage in Agile ceremonies and work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality features.
* **Code Quality**: Write clean, maintainable code using best practices like TDD, peer reviews, and CI/CD pipelines.
* **Independent contributor**: Should be able to complete the job by themselves without needing additional help. and should be able to mentor juniors.
* **Problem Solving & Innovation**: Work on complex, data-driven models, taking full ownership of the solutions you build and ensure they meet the required business outcomes.

 **Technical Skills Required:**

* **Frontend**: Strong experience with **React** and **TypeScript** for building user-friendly interfaces.
* **Backend Development**: Extensive experience in **Python** for building and maintaining backend systems and RESTful APIs. Familiarity with Python-based frameworks (e.g., Flask, Django) is desirable.
* **DevOps Tools**: Experience with CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code.
* **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**: Familiarity with building and deploying applications and services of GCP.
* **Terraform**: Experience in managing infrastructure as code. And have worked on pipelines to be enabled for it.
* **GitHub Workflows**: Knowledge of automating workflows with GitHub Actions and deployment in google cloud with it.

**Work Environment:**

* Office attendance required atleast once a week in **Helsingborg**.
* Collaboration with global teams, focusing on delivering software solutions with high quality and clean code.
* **Agile Methodology**: Demonstrated ability to work in an Agile environment, contribute to sprints, and deliver incremental value.
company_description: We strive to be the most trusted partner for the world’s hardest engineering problems.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
### **Role Description**


BrightBid is one of Sweden's fastest-growing AdTech companies utilizing AI and human expertise to create a more refined Ads solution for businesses to drive customer acquisition via Google Ads and Bing. Combined with BrightBid’s marketing and sales expertise, its AI- and human-led offering enables companies to compete, seeing at least a 35% increase in results on average. BrightBid is in the top 10% of fastest-growing SaaS companies globally and has achieved over 500,000 conversions for its 400+ customers. BrightBid has offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, London, Oslo and Manila.


We are looking for a frontend developer to join our software engineering team and help us develop, deliver and maintain features in our AI powered web based application.  

  

You will be collaborating closely with the product team as well as the rest of our engineering teams, to implement and deliver a good user experience to our customers.

##### **Responsibilities**

* Build, maintain, and improve both internal and external user interfaces at BrightBid.
* Collaborate within cross-functional teams; as a frontend developer at BrightBid, you will engage closely with designers, product owners, and fellow developers.
* Following modern framework best practices and writing maintainable frontend code and sharing your knowledge and learnings within the team.
* Implement UI designs according to our UX guidelines and provide feedback to help maintain consistency throughout the application.
* Provide feedback to product team about implementation decisions and challenges
* Continuously communicate with backend developers to ensure high quality APIs and accurate data transfer.
* Own and champion technical improvements to the frontend stack

##### **What we are looking for**

* 4+ years of relevant experience and proven track record within frontend development.
* Proficiency in modern JavaScript frameworks and state management libraries, preferably VueJS, Vuex, and TailwindCSS.
* Knowledge of working with CI/CD workflows.
* Comfortable working with REST APIs.
* Solid understanding of software design and development principles
* Since we are an international company, you must be able to communicate in English at professional level.

 **Why you should choose BrightBid**

* We have had a yearly growth of 400% since the foundation
* We are open in 5 different markets (Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo, London and Manila)
* Wellness allowance
* All the technical tools that you need to succeed in this role such as macbooks, monitors and more if necessary!
* Hybrid working place
* AWs and kickoffs with the team
* Free breakfast at the office
* An amazing team with high energy!

  

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Senior .NET-utvecklare
description:
Är du en .NET-utvecklare som drömmer om en arbetsplats där du får bredda och fördjupa dina kunskaper i flera intressanta projekt? Då är Knowit Solutions Cloud & Code något för dig!


Vi frågade vår vän ChatGTP efter 3 anledningar till varför du som systemutvecklare bör arbeta hos oss på Knowit, och fick följande svar:



* På Knowit kan du förvänta dig att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och lösningarna eftersom företaget är fokuserat på digital transformation och innovation. Detta kan ge värdefull erfarenhet för dig som utvecklare och bidra till att forma framtiden för olika branscher.


* Knowit har ett rykte för en anställningsvänlig arbetskultur, som betonar balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Detta kan skapa en stödjande och gynnsam arbetsmiljö för dig att prestera på din bästa nivå samtidigt som du bibehåller en hälsosam balans mellan arbete och fritid.


* Knowit tillhandahåller olika professionella utvecklingsprogram, såsom utbildning, mentorskap och kunskapsdelning, som kan hjälpa dig att kontinuerligt lära och växa i din karriär. Dessutom kan du ha möjlighet att arbeta med och lära från experter inom olika områden, vilket kan vara värdefullt för din professionella tillväxt.  

  

Vi håller helt med ovanstående, men vi som arbetar hos Knowit vill gärna lägga till några fler anledningar:
* Gemenskapen: i vårt team fokuserar vi på att växa tillsammans


* Personerna: Hos oss arbetar drivna, kompetenta och underbara människor. Det finns alltid hjärterum för fler.


Möjligheterna: Hos Knowit kan du som utvecklare styra din egen utvecklingsbana. Vi är måna om att du får arbeta med tekniker och uppdrag som du har intresse för. Dit du vill, vill vi.  

* 
  

Det var lite kort om vilka vi är, nu är vi väldigt nyfikna på vem du är? För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:

* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av Microsofttekniker
* Djupgående kunskaper i C# och .NET
* Goda kunskaper inom Azure eller AWS
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska

Knowit arbetar kontinuerligt med interna AI-projekt och värdesätter certifieringar inom AI 900 och AI 102 för att stärka vår expertis.


För att trivas i rollen ser vi även att du:

* Har ett stort intresse för teknik
* Har ett konsultmässigt arbetssätt

Är väl insatt i modern utvecklingsmetodik  
* 

Är detta du? Skicka in din ansökan till oss redan idag. Vi ser fram emot att höra av dig!


Har du några frågor eller funderingar angående tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Felicia Oor på felicia.oor@knowit.se.

title: Full Stack Developer (mid level)
description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.
   

  

 We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our Stockholm Studio, home to Rovio’s iconic game Angry Birds 2. As a Full Stack Developer, you will join our growing Technology craft and work on improving and expanding our internal tools and services, which support the entire Angry Birds 2 game team. This role will contribute to delivering a seamless experience to our players by enhancing and refining our inhouse tools, focusing on both user experience and performance optimization.
   

  

 Our studio is located in the heart of Stockholm, offering a vibrant, creative environment.
   

  

 Unfortunately, we are unable to provide relocation support for this position.
   

  

 You will have impact and fun at work by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining web tools and services for Angry Birds 2 using React
* Developing REST APIs in C# and .NET Core for game-related tooling
* Collaborating in sprint planning, peer code reviews, and bug fixing
* Writing clean, maintainable code, including testing (unit testing) and documentation
* Working as a team with other developers, designers and artists


 Experience and skills we are looking for:
   

  

* A few years of experience working with Typescript and React (or similar frontend technologies)
* Web development experience with modern TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and React, as you will spend part of your time working on the Frontend of the tooling
* Recent experience with C# and .NET Core, along with PostgreSQL
* Experience developing RESTful services
* Practical experience working in Agile software development teams, utilising Scrum or Kanban
* Collaborative mentality with strong communication skills in English

title: Back End Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Travel Arrangements
description:
**Who we are?** 




 We Dibbers are passionate travel enthusiasts who want to make travel planning as easy as possible – a few clicks and you are ready to go! We have built a Swedish cutting-edge online platform to streamline and digitalize the travel experience for companies, individual travelers and wanderlust groups. We are an innovative team who moves the limits and who loves to celebrate success!
 



 We are thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for a talented
 **Senior Backend Developer** 
 to join our team! Our passion for travel is what drives us, and we are looking for someone who shares that same enthusiasm. As our new
 **Senior Backend Developer** 
 based in Stockholm, you will play a key role in architecting and developing our all-in-one platform. If you’re ready to join us on our quest to create a state-of-the-art platform and help people explore the world, let’s connect and discuss how you can make a difference.
 



  





**What do we need?** 



* You possess an exceptional knowledge of Java (Functional Java, Java Stream), Spring Boot, Microservices, CI/CD, PostgreSQL, and MySQL, with a preferred minimum of 5+ years of experience in these areas.
* Accountable, reliable, and able to hit the ground running with an enthusiastic and motivated attitude.
* Bonus points if you have experience with Maven, Mongo, AWS, event-driven architecture and developing Rest APIs.
* You should have a good understanding of the full development lifecycle and the Agile Software Development Life Cycle, with exposure to Scrum projects.
* Familiarity with Continuous Integration is a plus.
* Proficiency in object-oriented programming and software engineering principles is essential.
* Open-minded, analytical, and able to problem-solve creatively, in other words, a real-time player.
* Fluency in English (oral and written) is a must, with knowledge of other languages being an advantage.



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Develop and maintain a high-quality code that adheres to coding standards, conventions and approved designs.
* Investigate and evaluate new and emerging technologies to maximize development efficiency and productivity.
* Co-architect the eco-system around the platform together with your teammates
* Collaborate with product managers, quality assurance representatives, and other developers to accurately estimate system issue resolution or package implementation efforts.
* Deploy and release new features and functionality in a timely manner.
* Create technical design specifications, participate in design reviews, and provide input to design recommendations.
* Conduct unit and integration testing of applications and troubleshoot and resolve any code-related issues or bugs.
* Write comprehensive code comments and debug code to ensure the highest quality of code.
* Ensure compliance with team or project processes and procedures.



  





**What’s awesome about working at DIB?** 



* Be part of a rapidly growing company with the opportunity to influence the development of our platform;
* Hybrid working policy.
* A nice and social office in a great central location.
* We prioritize your growth and development, offering training and education opportunities.
* It is not our goal to box you in, on the contrary, it is to allow you to grow and self-improve through our performance management process. We have a well-organized career path, according to your professional ambition within our company.



  





 If you’re ready to make an impact and grow with us, we’d love to hear from you! Please apply through Linkedin or send your application directly in English to hr@dibtravel.com.

title: Software Developer
description:

* Refresh UIs for DROC validation using elastic search
* Support DROC to write spark/hive queries if needed to analyze a dataset
* Support dev team and DROC team for config changes if specified by the relevant team.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Understand end to end ETL pipeline
* Competent within data engineering principles:
* Write Hive SQL (SPARK) queries (crucial)
* SCALA knowledge (crucial) o Shell scripting (important)
* How to work on Cloudera distribution (Oozie) (important)
* Elasticsearch (basic knowledge) o Quantexa (important)
* Familiar with but not needed to expert in:
* IntelliJ
* Zeppelin
* Bamboo, Jenkins, Nexus, Artifactory, Kafka
* Hands-on development experience (Java, Scala, etc.) via system integration projects
* Quantexa certified + Upgrade experience
* Fraud, financial crime, customer insight or compliance-based projects experience that utilize detection or predictive models
* Familiarity with agile development methodology
* Experience with projects involving statistical approaches or detection logic
* Experience with data mapping, relational data and object orientation
* Experience with data processing such as ETL as well as parsing and handling data quality related issues
* Understanding of operational environments and DevOps processes
* Development environment skills (code control, IDEs), and a solid understanding of development processes such as unit testing, design, and documentation
* Hand-on experience with Hadoop, Spark and Scala
* Ideally: Python, Elastic, Restful APIs JSON, Tomcat
* Extensive us of external tools such as GIT and Jenkins


**Application deadline:** 
 22-10-2024
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Back-End Developer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we are on the lookout for a talented Backend Developer with a DevOps mindset to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and crafting modern products that positively impact our merchants' lives. If this introduction sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 PayPal in Sweden originated from Zettle, focusing on commerce services targeting small and medium businesses, and is now expanding to contribute to the wider PayPal portfolio.
   

  

**Meet our team**
 In this role, you'll join our PayPal Engineering Team responsible for designing, building, deploying, and maintaining backend Java services. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of talented individuals from engineering, product, and design to create solutions that power PayPal's customer experiences.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 Joining us means partnering with Product and Design counterparts who share a commitment to enhancing our merchants' daily experiences. Here, you will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Continuously innovate and deliver awesome experiences for our users Solve the real customer problems through technology.
* Demonstrate and sharpen your problem-solving skills in both day-to-day work as well as during lab days and hack weeks.
* Co-elaborate with your peers across our Backend Engineering chapter, working on platform improvements and increasing learning opportunities for and creating opportunities for growth in a supportive environment.


**Your day to day**
* Develop clean, maintainable, high-quality Java code.
* Take ownership of the delivery – your own, and your peer engineers in the team.
* Design, build, deploy, and maintain services powering PayPal's customer experiences.
* Collaborate with other skilled and motivated engineers on the team (Java Backend, iOS, Android and QA) as well as product and design to deliver a world-class experience.
* Continuously raise the bar on the quality and customer focus in the products we develop.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Proven / Practical experience of developing back-end services in Java and/or Kotlin.
* Focus on delivery, attention to detail and quality of the end result.
* Practical experience of designing, building and maintaining distributed systems in a cloud-native environment.
* Experience working in an agile development team, using common tools like Jira and GitHub.
* Examples of growing yourself and/or people around you – learning from others and sharing your knowledge, experiences and opinions.
* Experience in cloud infrastructure (we primarily use AWS).


**Get bonus points if you also have...**
* Familiarity with FinTech industry payment transactions.


 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to
 **apply** 
 and / or
 **let's chat!**
**\_**
 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0113297

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**The Role:** 
 Software Engineer
   

  

**The Team:** 
 The development team is based in Stockholm and consists of 8 highly skilled individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing their unique part in serving our global customer base. Everyone on the team shares the responsibility of meeting all functional and non-functional requirements, and you’ll find that the team decisions cover not only business-related improvements but also a wide variety of technical topics such as architectural styles, Container platforms operators, microservice boundaries, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability solutions, frontend frameworks and much much more. The team is responsible for a complex system requiring a lot of collaboration within the team and with other parts of the technology organisation and we value learning from each other in order to continuously improve ourselves and the user experience.
   

  

**The Impact:** 
 OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. OSTTRA triResolve Margin is our post-trade service that offers an automated workflow for the margin call process as well as a system for managing collateral. Improvement of OSTTRA triResolve Margin has far-reaching effects in this important segment of the financial industry, not only through expanded capabilities of other integrated OSTTRA services, but also directly through operational efficiency improvements and cost reductions for many of the largest banks in the world.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* Influence the future of a market-leading solution together with highly skilled people across the globe
* Work in an empowered cross-functional engineering team with people who want you to succeed
* Learn about the financial industry and contribute to the stability of the global financial system
* Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including e.g. Container platforms, Golang, Python and ClojureScript)


**Responsibilites**
* Actively contribute to meet new and changing business needs
* Ensure that non-functional requirements are established and met
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
* Engage in continuous learning to keep up with industry best practices


**What We’re Looking For**
* A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
* 3-5 years of relevant experience
* Excellent communication skills (fluency in English is a must)
* A bold and humble team player
* Business mindedness and a solution-oriented mindset
* An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you and our ways of working.


**We also prefer if you have one or more of the following:**
* An interest in financial markets
* A passion for technology


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
