title: IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Architects who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects! We develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying our technical know-how, experience in IT projects, and analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 Shape the world of tomorrow
   

  

* Shape the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating their capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* Manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be in charge of the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements such as cyber resilience
* Analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 You can help us make a difference if you
   

  

* have a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, engineering, or a related field
* have approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting or software development (part or full time)
* know that modern tools such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords, but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* have broad technical expertise and interest in technology trends
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 How you can grow with us
   

  

 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*

title: Senior Azure Specialist
description:
**S E N I O R A Z U R E S P E C I A L I S T** 




 Full-time | Permanent
 



  





  





**W H A T W E N E E D 🙏🏻** 




 We are looking for a driven
 **Senior Azure Specialist** 
 to join Xenit's Cloud Enablement Team (XCET).
 



 We are interested in someone who has been working within Infrastructure and Cloud for quite a few years. Perhaps someone who comes from a traditional on-premise world and found their way to Azure?
 



 We'd like to see someone who has experience with transition and transformation projects, someone who feels confident in their knowledge/expertise, someone who can say
 **"I'm here, I'm ready. Give me a customer - Let's rock and roll!"** 




  





**Examples of potential tasks:** 



* Customer projects vary from: Implementing Enterprise Scale to Transition and Transformation projects
* Guide customers on their Cloud journey
* Deployment and configuration with Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Working with our CloudOps service for our customers, responding to tickets assigned to the team.



  





**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?** 




**We believe our next Azure Specialist has:** 



* Preferably 5+ years of experience with Azure



 (we can be flexible with this based on how much hands on work you have done)
 


* A technical breadth of experience within Infrastructure - Windows Server, AD, Networking and Security
* Experience within IaaS and PaaS
* Good track record within Cloud Migration and Transformation Projects
* Knowledge about Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure



  





**Bonus If You Have:** 



* Automation/Scripting Experience
* Terraform/IaC
* Azure DevOps
* Certifications: AZ-104, AZ-305, Terraform Associate



  





**We Also Believe That You Are a Person Who** 



* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes responsibility for their work
* Actually loves tech and wants to keep up to date in their field
* Collaborates effectively with others and builds good relationships with both customers and colleagues
* Enjoys sharing knowledge and experiences in order to support colleagues in reaching common goals
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do 💕



  





  





**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?** 




**Benefits 🎁** 




 Xenit boasts a large benefits package, including but not limited to: Wellness allowance, health insurance, föräldralön bonus, ergonomic workplaces and more.
 



 Please see our career site for a full list.
 



  





 Xenit was also recently awarded
 **"Career Company of 2024"** 
 . This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.
 



***"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."***




 Read more about Karriar Företagen here.
 



  





 And let's not forget, we are Microsoft Partner of the Year Sweden 2024 🎉🥂
 



  





 ... So what are you waiting for? Apply now!
 



  





  





*If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our Head of Talent: Abigail Chapman 💌* 




*Read more here: https://xenit.se/* 




  





*Disclaimer: Application information may be shared, in some instances, within the co-native group.*

title: Senior Infrastrukturspecialist
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 I rollen ingår att vara rådgivare baserat på erfarenhet av komplexa installationer i större organisationer. Rollen ska även bidra till design av lösningar samt stöttning i lösningsframtagande.
   

  

 Arbetet ställer stora krav på självständighet och framåtanda. Det dagliga arbetet kan under perioder innebära högt tempo och många samtidiga arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Arbetet bedrivs teambaserat och tillämpar agila arbetssätt. I rollen förväntas du bidra till kompetensspridning både inom teamet och närliggande team.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* 10 års erfarenhet av praktiskt arbete med utveckling och underhåll av storskaliga Windows Server miljöer i lokal regi samt av att dokumentera lösningar och utredningar kopplat till området
* 15 års arbetserfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsofts ”tier” modell och rollbaserad åtkomst i större organisation
* 15 års arbetslivserfarenhet och kompetens av ADFS och koncepten SAML,OIDC/OAuth 2.0
* 110 års arbetslivserfarenhet och kompetens inom PKI, smarta kort och certifikatshantering
* 110 års arbetslivserfarenhet och kompetens av automatisering med Powershell skriptning och C#/.NET inom ovanstående områden


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt
* Erfarenhet av utveckling och undehåll av stora komplexa Windowsmiljöer med flera organisatoriska nyttjare
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från en stor myndighet med minst 10 000 anställda


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 22-10-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: ML Ops Engineer, Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Do you want to be part of our in-house Machine Learning team and take part in PostNord’s digital transformation journey? Do you wish to work hands-on across the whole data engineering area? Then you should apply for this position as a ML Ops Engineer!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas, such as e.g. HR, mail and logistics. We are already delivering business critical forecasting models that are an important piece of the puzzle of optimizing our operations. Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platforms to Azure. We are now using that platform to train our ML models on our data sets to enable data-driven decision making.
   

  

 Our technology is focused on the Azure stack, and includes Azure MLW, Azure ML, Azure DevOps, Power BI etc.
   

  

 The Machine Learning team’s main responsibility is to develop and operate ML models used by PostNord production units. As an ML Ops engineer, your role is hands-on, focusing on operating and optimizing our ML workloads and model releases.
   

  

 As an ML Ops Engineer you will lead and direct the teams DevOps practices, including version controlling and managing the teams repos.
   

  

 You will be responsible for improving our monitoring/alerting systems for our ML workloads.
   

  

 You'll work closely with a team of data scientists to monitor and improve model accuracy, prevent drift, and improve the cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To fit in the ML Ops Engineer role at PostNord you have been working with software development on an advanced level for several years. It is important that you like to remain hands on, able to take a lead role and enjoy working on complex and challenging solutions.
   

  

 You have a structured approach to code management and can help the team develop code according to best practices.
   

  

 As a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state of the art pace in the domain that you work in.
   

  

**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
* Communication skills in both written and spoken English
* 5+ years of experience in data engineering, CI/CD, DevOps, or ML Ops (preferably in an Azure environment).
* Expert skills in version controlling, source code management and artifact management.
* Experience with ML Ops workflows and DevOps practices, including model versioning, automated model retraining, and monitoring.
* Familiar with AI/ML concepts and algorithms.
* Implemented ML Ops best practices such as model drift detection and model governance.


**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Experience working in an agile team
* Deep understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
* Experience with forecasting and knowledge of time series analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
* Experience in defining data models, schemas, and structures for efficient storage and retrieval of data.
* Azure or AWS Certified.
* Communication skills in both written and spoken Swedish.
* Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.
* Experienced in Azure DevOps, ADF, metadata-driven pipelines, Azure Data bricks, ARM templates, and Azure Functions.


 We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to visit on site on a regular basis.
   

  

**We Offer You**
* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center (Solna).
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
* Employment in Solna/Hybrid.


 Welcome with your application!
   

  

 Selection is ongoing and we want your application as soon as possible. For questions about the role contact us through our recruitment platform Varbi.
   

  

**About PostNord Group AB**
 We make everyday life easier! PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal- and logistic services to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Ubuntu Engineering Delivery and Excellence Manager
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Quality Engineering Manager for our Ubuntu Quality Engineering team, with an impactful mission to take our Linux distro quality to a new level through automation and large-scale data analysis.
   

  

 As the Ubuntu Quality Engineering Manager, you must be an experienced engineer who has built large-scale software quality assurance frameworks, is passionate about the future of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of mission-critical requirements related to shipping the best Linux distro to users and partners world-wide. You will work closely with the various teams involved in creating Ubuntu and influence their practices to improve quality in every step of Ubuntu engineering. Your goal is to rethink the way a Linux distro approaches quality - bringing together automation, third-party analysis tooling, feedback loops from the community and user base, and our own test capabilities. Your team will monitor, develop and improve the quality of the Ubuntu System, to drive quality excellence and best DevOps practices among Ubuntu Desktop, Server, Containers and VM at package, system, and cluster levels.
   

  

 As every engineering manager at Canonical, your role is technical but your focus is your team. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important and satisfying work, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and experience as a software engineer are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop strong engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 Location: Global worldwide
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Define and monitor quality metrics for the most popular Linux distro in the world
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices
* Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
* Setup and maintain continuous integration for all supported deliverables
* Develop a team with a culture of high quality and performance
* Work from home with international travel twice per year for up to two weeks


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You have a strong software engineering, Linux, and open source background
* Your technical knowledge includes C/C++, Python programming, and Shell scripting
* You have experience with quality processes and continuous integration tools and principles
* You have engineering management experience and enjoy growing people
* You are a strong proponent of data-driven decision making


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* A good understanding of Debian packaging and snaps will be valuable
* Familiarity with an agile development environment


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: AI Tech Lead
description:
Are you looking for a role within an exciting world of AI technologies, where you can both contribute with your expertise and keep on developing?
   

  

 We are starting a new chapter within ASSA ABLOY’s organization, and we are looking for top talent to help us grow our AI Technical Development Teams from scratch.
   

  

 Join our Team in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as our AI Tech Lead**
 You will be a technical lead within a team of 6, working closely with Team Lead, guiding the team in modern development practices in cloud, backend and frontend development, working with our brand-new project related to AI Technical Development, based in Stockholm..
   

  

 You will play a key role, acting as a business advisor, interfacing with multiple stakeholders, business, and product owners within entire ASSA ABLOY structure.
   

  

 We work in cross-functional teams, responsible for developing modern, secure and top-quality solutions. We develop embedded applications and integrate them with Mobile Applications, Electronic Access Control software using cloud and microservice architecture. You would also:
   

  

* Stay up to date with the latest AI technologies.
* Be responsible for hands-on R&D Development.
* Interact with tech- and non-tech stakeholders, proposing solutions and negotiating.


**The Skills And Experience You Need.**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* has several years of experience with designing both application architecture and cloud architecture (Azure or AWS).
* has previous DevOps and testing experience.
* is up to date with AI solutions and will be eager to promote AI best practices and processes across global cross-functional Teams.
* is experienced in leading and organizing DevOps teams working in an agile environment.
* is fluent in English, spoken and written.


**What we offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Hybrid model of working.
* Flexible working hours.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait.**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Lead Delivery Manager Global
company_industry: Architecture and Planning, Construction, and Civil Engineering
description:
**Position Overview**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced
 **Lead** 
 Delivery Manager to join our dynamic, global team. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the timely and efficient delivery of solutions, coordinating global cross-functional teams, and maintaining high standards of quality and customer satisfaction. In this role, you will also play a key part in establishing and refining delivery processes and practices to enhance the overall effectiveness and consistency of solution delivery across regions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of solutions from inception to completion.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define solution scope, objectives, and deliverables.
* Develop detailed plans, including timelines, resource/people allocation, and risk management.
* Lead and coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure milestones and deliverables are met.
* Monitor solution progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions to keep projects on track.
* Establish and continuously improve delivery processes and methodologies to support consistent and efficient project execution.
* Work closely with team members and stakeholders to promote adherence to best practices and standards.
* Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment.
* Ensure consistent communication and reporting to stakeholders and leadership on solution status, risks, and outcomes.
* Manage budgets and ensure delivery within financial constraints.
* Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and standards.
* Coach and mentor more junior delivery managers and team members.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Delivery Manager or in a similar role such as a Scrum Master, Project Manager, or Product Owner.
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies and practices, specifically Scrum, Kanban, and XP.
* Experience working with global teams and customers.
* Exceptional attention to detail and organizational abilities.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Proficiency in delivery management and SDLC software and tools such as Jira, Azure DevOps, GitHub Enterprise, or similar.
* Experience in establishing and refining delivery processes and methodologies.
* Ability to coach technical teams, peers, and leadership in agile practices and values.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Excellent leadership skills.
* Familiarity with modern development practices and methodologies.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, GitHub, Azure DevOps.


**Contact Information**
 Hiring Manager, Melanie Ranger, melanie.ranger@wsp.com

title: Release Manager
description:
*Are you ready for the next step in your career? We are looking for a Release Manager & Scrum Master to Mycronic.* 




  





**ABOUT MYCRONIC** 




 Mycronic are on the cutting edge of software development, working with one of the most advanced products in the industry. Their collaborative team of experienced developers embraces an open mindset, working together to solve challenges and push the boundaries of what's possible. Mycronic foster innovation, encouraging development and exploring new paths to problem-solving. Join Mycronic, and you'll be part of a dynamic environment where you're challenged to enhance quality and contribute innovative solutions.
 



  





**AOUT THE ROLE** 




 As a Software Release Manager & Scrum Master, you will combine leadership, project management, and technical expertise to oversee the release management lifecycle and champion Agile practices. You will also ensure that all software releases comply with trade and security regulations, working closely with expert and cross-functional teams to meet both technical and legal requirements.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITY:** 



* Plan, schedule, and coordinate software releases, ensuring timely and smooth delivery.
* Manage and mitigate risks and issues that affect release scope, schedule, and quality.
* Collaborate with DevOps, QA, and development teams to ensure correct functionality and software content is included in the expected releases to keep the entire release train synchronized.
* Ensure releases comply with internal security policies and external regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).
* Ensure all software releases meet necessary trade compliance regulations, including export controls and other international standards.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of software licensing and trade regulations, working closely with legal and compliance teams.
* Lead daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, and other Agile ceremonies.
* Coach and mentor teams on Agile practices and principles to ensure high performance and continuous improvement.
* Remove roadblocks, facilitate collaboration, and ensure alignment with product goals.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams including development, QA, DevOps, product management, legal, and security.
* Act as the main point of contact for stakeholders on release planning, status, coordination, and compliance matters.
* Promote a culture of transparency, accountability, and compliance, ensuring clear communication across all levels.



  





**WHO ARE YOU?** 




 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
 


* 3+ years of experience in a Software Release Manager or Scrum Master role.
* Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
* Proven track record in managing multiple, complex software releases in a fast-paced environment.
* Familiarity with trade compliance and security compliance in the context of software releases.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English



 It is also beneficial if you have:
 


* Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM).
* Release Management certifications are a plus.
* Knowledge of trade and security compliance regulations is highly advantageous.



**But most importantly we believe that you have:** 



* Strong leadership and coaching abilities to guide Agile teams toward success.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Problem-solving mindset with the ability to navigate technical, compliance, and security challenges.



  





**OTHER INFORMATION:** 




**Start:** 
 beginning of 2025
 



**Location:** 
 Täby
 



**Scope:** 
 Fulltime, possible to remote 1 day/week
 



**Employment:** 
 This is a direct employment with Mycronic, terms and conditions will be discussed seperately.

title: Senior Data Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight!**
**Normative is now looking for a Senior Software Engineer in Stockholm.**
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a passionate and curious Senior Data Engineer to play a key role in architecting the data-driven foundation at Normative. As part of our dynamic R&D team, you will be the primary contact for designing, building, and managing the data analytics infrastructure necessary for generating valuable insights.
   

  

 This includes building dashboards, generating actionable insights, building out our data analytical infrastructure, and ensuring organizations can efficiently measure and understand their emissions. Without context, data is just numbers – you help us transform data into the sustainability intelligence needed to achieve net zero.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Design, build, and manage the foundation of the analytics data platform at Normative.
* Collaborate with Product teams, DevOps engineers, and Data Scientists to address Normative’s data challenges.
* Drive the development of internal tools related to data analytics and data quality.
* Develop efficient and reliable data pipelines.
* Share your knowledge of data best practices and learn alongside your colleagues.


**This role is for you if**
* You are motivated to be part of a team working against climate change.
* You have experience in a similar role – as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist, or Software Engineer – and have expertise in designing, building, and maintaining cloud-based data infrastructure.
* You have utilized modern analytics tools such as Snowflake or BigQuery for warehousing, Airflow or DBT for orchestration, and Looker or Tableau for visualization.
* You are proficient in using the Python data stack and SQL for analytics.
* You enjoy exploring new datasets and using your data analytics and visualization skills to explore and explain.


**We Also Believe You Are**
* Someone who is committed to making a meaningful contribution towards a sustainable future.
* Comfortable working in an environment with the typical challenges of a growing company, asking questions, and learning new things.


 We also believe you enjoy working in an environment with typical challenges of a growing company, asking a lot of questions and learning new things. At Normative we believe that collaboration with teammates is essential and you’ll thrive if you like to explain and discuss technical approaches with other engineers.
   

  

 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for Engineering, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
   

  

 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
   

  

*Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Apply anyway!*
**Location**
 Normative operates on a hybrid remote model with offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and London. For this role you will be located in our wonderful HQ in Stockholm or remotely in Sweden.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

**Our Interview Process Consists Of 4 Stages**
* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager


*Online Personality & Logic assessment*
* Technical interview with members of the Engineering team
* Final Interview


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Senior Python Developer
description:
Description of service and team
   

  

 You will join our Monitoring & IT Configuration Management team consisting of both Swedish and offshore developers. You will work closely with our developers but also be expected to collaborate with our internal customers, within CGI Scandinavia.
   

  

 Our services are built on OnPrem platforms, and process data from various internal and external systems. This data is used for business intelligence, reporting, and billing. We are currently working on how to utilise this data for proactive automation and integrate this into our webapp.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Your role will be to help us design, develop/build, maintain and improve resilience and scalability of our service for new and existing components. You will also be working to help solve problems within our service.
   

  

 You will be empowered to make decisions that directly impact the future of the service such integration design, programming languages and platforms used as long as you can build the case for these and ensure knowledge transfer within the team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 You are someone who can get the job done.
   

  

 You are passionate about designing and building robust, scalable systems that are easily refactorable when requirements change.
   

  

 You may not have a background working with data and machine learning, but are interested in this area too.
   

  

 You want to join a team where you can help mentor developers in best development practices and ways of working, in a hands-on in a high-paced environment. You are analytical and like solving problems.
   

  

 You are interested in automation and finding ways to make these work in a complex Enterprise environment with multiple dependencies.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* Have 5 years or more experience programming (Python)
* Good knowledge of Linux
* Solid experience in server applications and relational databases (Postgres & MySQL)
* Some Javascript experience
* Docker & Kubernetes (Tanzu) for deploying services in containers
* Azure DevOps
* Some GoLang
* Understanding of ITIL
* Are familiar with the principles and concepts of event-driven architecture and infrastructure as code; and can help drive good practices within CGI GTO Scandinavia
* Are comfortable working closely with stakeholders & can present or run workshops in a professional manner
* Good written and spoken English
* Swedish


 It's an added bonus if you:
   

  

* Have experience with GraphQL and Machine Learning/AI
* Have experience with AIOps
* Have experience with Cloud platforms
* Have experience with platforms such as Ansible and SaltStack


 What can we offer you?
   

  

 We have a good team culture. Our team consists of a good mix of personalities, skill sets and cultures who love to workshop ideas and problem solve together. At CGI, there are also great opportunities for internal career paths where you can choose to become a specialist within your field, broaden your horizons in new areas, or take on a senior position. If you share our dream: "To create an environment in which we enjoy working together and, as owners, contribute to building a company we can be proud of.", then you are the one we are looking for!
   

  

 More about our benefits:
   

  

* Share program and partnership: As a shareholder, you have the opportunity to influence in our share program, CGI matches your contribution up to 3% of your monthly salary.
* Work-life balance: We offer flexible working hours, hybrid workplaces (based on customer) to make the work-life balance smoother.
* Wellness allowance: We offer an annual wellness allowance of SEK 4,000.
* Parental leave pay: We pay up to about 90% of your salary during the first time at home.
* Secure employment: Our members has collective agreements and insurances.
* Pension solutions: We offer attractive pension solutions.
* CGI Academia & Campus: We value lifelong learning! Our e-learning service offers you to develop in your current or elective fields.
* Company car: The company car is used as a private car but is leased by CGI.


 Background checks and security checks may be required.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Licence Administration and Support, Microsoft Infrastructure, Oracle, Cloud, Remote Working (h/f)
description:

Are you a systems support or administration consultant with experience in managing and supporting licences?

  

emagine is looking for your skills to support an infrastructure team by monitoring, reporting and advising on Licence Services. You will be working in an international team based in Europe and supporting a global organisation.

title: Technology Architect - People Domain
description:
**Job ID:** 262878


**Date posted:** 16/10/2024


**Why we will love you**  

  

You have a passion for technology and innovation, it makes you appreciate the mix of actions and strategic thinking, turning architecture into practice. You have a product-centric mindset, are open to change and get energized working both independently and interdependently. You share and live the IKEA culture and values.
  

  

To be successful as a Technology Architect you have proven advanced education in information technology, computer science or equivalent. We believe you have a minimum of 5 years of experience from product and engineering organizations where you have had proven Domain Architecture responsibility stretching across multiple products and coexisting with legacy in the Technology Landscape. You are experienced in developing service architectures that are cloud-native, event-driven and applies an API First approach. You have worked with SAP Success Factor extensively plus Open Source and automation in delivering software. In addition, we also believe you have a deep understanding of Enterprise Architecture and how to keep a technology architecture together across a Product Area in the Technology landscape within in the retail business and how to modernize its existing legacy.
  

  

We see that you have a strategic and holistic mindset being able to define the future state of assigned domain as well as:
  

* You will be able to synthesize and incorporate key cross functional perspectives – co-worker experience, operational efficiency, regulatory, security and privacy considerations while designing solutions.
* Influence decisions at several levels of the company – from Sub-domain to engineering by providing clarity on what tools, patterns, and directions to accelerate delivery.

- Drive architecture work in a technology landscape that has multi-generational legacy products - Reduce waste through rationalization and standards.
  

* Develop architectures in the People Domain
* Solve deep technical problems in a landscape transforming with several business models
* Drive common purpose across diverse stakeholders
* Set long term strategic direction and manage its trade-offs
* Deep knowledge of Enterprise Architecture, Human resource landscape & cloud platform development
* Work outcome-led, across application and infrastructure architecture
* Experience in agile development practices
* Experience having worked with domain architecture in a product and engineering organization

  

As a person you are a good collaborator, have strong leadership skills leading architecture work and work with diverse stakeholders. You pay attention to detail and actively acquire new knowledge, skills and champions new methods to improve performance in deliveries. You possess knowledge across a range of different technology stacks, ideally applied within a retail sector, and can change direction based on new ideas, approaches and strategies.  

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

As a Technology Architect, you will develop the technology architecture landscape across IKEA and be part of setting the course with sound engineering/architecture through principles and standards that enable guidance for teams. By influencing decisions across multiple levels, you make sure to set and drive the future architecture across both legacy and digital products (at scale). Your personality allows you to balance common purpose amongst a diverse set of stakeholders to ensure reaching both short- and long-term goals.
  

  

In this role you are:
  

* Responsible to drive and develop the system architecture across design, build, engineering and implementation of technical solutions and capabilities, providing technical leadership, and long-range planning to align technology to business objectives ensuring the best fit within the larger IKEA ecosystem.
* Responsible for defining the future architecture direction for assigned domain, the coexistence with legacy, leverage domain driven design to define boundaries of the products and its respective capabilities.
* Responsible for defining the information flow between products and legacy within an area and across the landscape
* Resolve architecture topics in significant landscape changes affecting the sub-domain
* Provide the architecture perspective on prioritizations in a sub-domain context, its consequences and impact to reach the Sub-domain strategies and outcomes
* Drive and develop to the architecture roadmap view for the sub-domain as well as drive the execution
* Develop the Enterprise Architecture practices, and architecture guardrails used in our product teams along with being a champion of innovation and engineering excellence culture
* Document and communicate architectural vision, technical strategies, enterprise solutions, critical decisions, and trade-offs to gain buy-in
* You participate in acquisition activities including technical guidance and assessments from a technology landscape perspective
* Familiarity with Human Resource Tech tools that include People management, Talent management, People Planning, Total Rewards, People Data & insights, and coworker relationships.
* Good knowledge of standing up an Insights platform to enable personalization and measure the efficiency of content performance.

  

**About this work area**  

  

We set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace.
  

At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.
  

  

In our team we love puzzles and are always looking for ways to make things smarter, safer, and more user-friendly. We all come from diverse backgrounds and together we enable efficient product development and production through innovative engineering. Of course, we also make sure that our products live up to the highest standards of quality, design, function, price, and sustainability. In this role you will report to the Technology Architecture Manager  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

You might have questions regarding the role or the recruitment process or other practicalities, please get in touch with Rhian Denton.
  

  

We look forward to learning more about you!

title: Technology Strategy Manager
description:
*Join Accenture* *Technology* *Strategy* *team* *and* *lead our clients through their digital transformation journeys.*

 **Are you the one?**


We are searching for business and technology-driven consulting leaders to join our Technology Strategy & Advisory team in Malmö. We provide expertise and insights for leading clients through value-driven recommendation in the intersection between business and technology strategy. This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career at Accenture!

 **About Accenture Technology Strategy & Advisory:**

  

  

We at Technology Strategy & Advisory help our clients become industry leaders. With our cross-expertise in technology, strategy, and consulting, we work closely with our clients to find their focus areas in the market and identify organizational and technological building blocks to reach the target state. We are helping our clients, people, and society to create sustainable and digital change for the future, by applying our 360° value approach to identify value across financial, experience, sustainability, talent, and inclusion & diversity dimensions.

* Intelligent operating model and innovation – Create intelligent operating models to transform performance and build the foundation for agility and growth
* Data-driven enterprise – Unlock the value of data, architecture, and AI/GenAI to drive business agility and transformation to a real-time enterprise
* Tech ROI – Identify, quantify, maximize, and sustain value realization from technology investments
* Future tech – Advise clients on how to spearhead in the digital age by leveraging new and emerging technologies such as GenAI, IoT, XR and Connectivity
* And much more…
  

We pride ourselves in building long-lasting relationships with our clients by driving powerful outcomes and inspiring with impact, and we act as trusted advisors at the largest and most well-known companies in the Nordics and Globally. At Technology Strategy & Advisory we are building a community with the best people based on our Secret Sauce; we believe that transparency and openness, the ability to make impact and make yourself heard, together with a great team feeling and a sense of belonging are our keys to success.


  

**Who we are looking for:**

  

  

We are looking for curious people willing to question the current ways of working by utilizing disruptive technologies, agile ways of working and new business models in order to bring new ideas and innovations to life. With us you will have the possibility to work with true business transformation enabled by digital and be a key advisor for c-suites in leading Nordic companies. We hope you are someone who enjoys working in teams and can make everyone take advantage of their various strengths and areas of expertise to achieve the best possible results. To succeed in this role, you ideally have:

* Good business understanding of one or more industries and have around 6+ years of work experience from consulting or similar.
* Ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities and put ideas and findings into the right context for the right audience, both written and verbally.
* Experience and interest in Enterprise architecture, Cloud technology and agile models. Working with strategic advisory, profit realization and market analysis is compelling to you.
* An analytical and structural mindset, who can achieve impressive results and thrive in settings where you define, structure, and solve sometimes diffuse client asks.
* In addition to delivering projects, we are looking for experience in leading, managing, and developing high-performing teams, empowering others to succeed, and driving internal activities (e.g. recruiting, social, training, etc.).
* Master's degree in a relevant field with excellent academic results.
* Fluent in English (Swedish or another Nordic language is a plus).
* Flexibility in terms of travel and work across the Nordics is expected.
**What we can offer you:**

* Competitive benefit package: truly competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program and other benefits.
* Market-leading expertise and great learning opportunities: we use our global network of experts to stay up to date on technology and industry trends to be relevant in client dialogue - and we are never fully trained.
* Work in a team dedicated to complex problem solving: utilize the sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, which provide an unbeatable platform from which to advance your career.
* Fun at work and work-life balance - we make good arrangements to combine family life (and leisure time in general) with work life.

Are you excited by the opportunity? Apply now and attach your CV and Cover Letter in English. We look forward to receiving your application!

  

  

To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired, please visit our website: Accenture | Sweden | Let there be change

  

  

Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.


Do you have questions about the role?


Feel free to reach out to hedvig.orvenholt@accenture.com (Tech Strategy Consultant) or annika.venalainen@accenture.com (HR/Recruiting).

title: Senior Data Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Would you like to join a community where you will work with the latest technology and where you can grow your competence in a systematic manner? Would you also like to have flexibility in your work and working hours? Do you have experience in transformation projects and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the place for you!  

When joining Tietoevry as a Senior Data Architect:
In this position there are two main directions that you would utilize:
1. Business to technology: In this direction, you would be working closely with customer business, IT and other stakeholders with your Tietoevry Tech Services colleagues to translate their business goals into IT architecture and finally into technical solutions utilizing cloud native tools and services.
2. Technology to business: In this approach, you would bring thoughts and ideas on how our customers can benefit from cloud solutions in the best possible way.  

“Sounds interesting. So, what would be required from me?”* We expect you to have previous experience in design/implementation, deployment verification, migration / development application to Azure, GCP or AWS.
* Several years of experience in the traditional IT in addition to cloud.
* You should be enthusiast towards data and cloud architecture, designing and/or being a strong builder and executioner of these architectures including modelling of them.
* Communication with Swedish language is must as you would be working directly also with customer stakeholders who might prefer local language. Also some documentation customers are having might be written in Swedish.

  

It is great if you also have:* It really helps if you are possessing a history of successful IT consulting and architecture engagements with large-scale customers.
* Event-based / real-time architecture experience with technologies such as Kafka on Confluent.
* Hands-on experience on AI, ML, GenAI is big plus as several customers of ours have started their AI / GenAI journey.
* We provide assistance for our customers with their Data & Analytics and Roadmap development based on their Business goals (capturing As-Is state, To-be architecture and gaps) and building Transition state architecture. Experience in this kind of consulting cases is a big plus.
* Analytics domain experience on technologies such as Snowflake, Synapse, Databricks.
* Several of our customers are working with some kind of agile model like SAFe or Scrum so agile methods should be familiar to you. But if not, we have great learning capabilities also from these areas for you to master.


Did we get you inspired?
We look forward to your application!  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Mauri Tusa, mauri.tusa@tietoevry.com.  

Hope to hear from you soon!*We background checks on all final candidates.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*  

About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.  

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good  

#LI-Hybrid
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. title: Area Architect - Volvo Group Connected Solutions
description:
**We are committed to being a driving force in the transition to efficient, fossil-free, and safe means of transport. Great progress is achieved by connecting great people, because together, we shape the world we want to live in.**

**This is us, your new colleagues**
-----------------------------------

Volvo Group Connected Solutions is a software company within the Volvo Group.


We have around 900 highly skilled employees, working at the forefront of vehicle connectivity.


By collecting, analyzing, and using data from 1.6 million+ connected vehicles, we make the world of transportation safer, cleaner, and more efficient. Add electrification and automation to the mix, and we are shaping the future of transportation.


Our main hub and office are located in Lindholmen, Gothenburg, but we also have offices in Silicon Valley and Greensboro in the US, Curitiba in Brazil, Bangalore in India and China.

  

At Volvo Group Connected Solutions, we believe that connectivity is the key to making a difference. With vast amounts of data, we are pushing boundaries for what connectivity can do in a transforming industry.

**Foundation Services Area Architect**
--------------------------------------

As the Foundation Services Area Architect and a member of the Foundation Services Management team, you will play a vital role in shaping the platform architectural landscape for our organization. Your holistic view of the platform's architectural structure and your understanding of how various initiatives interact with the surrounding environment are crucial

  

* With your skilled architecture knowledge, you will need to understand how different components of the architecture—systems, applications, and services—fit together
* This comprehensive view will enable you to identify potential synergies and efficiencies that can be leveraged to optimize performance and reduce costs for our platform central services
* However, this work is not done in isolation. You, in a leading position, will collaborate closely with the Foundation Services Domain Architects and Business Analyst and other stakeholders within our and outside our organization.

  

This role demands not only technical expertise but also strong leadership, communication, and strategic thinking to drive architecture that maximizes value for the platform central services, our organization as such.

  

We are in an exciting stage, with the recent launch of a new cloud environment platform. Your role as the Foundation Services Area Architect will be central in maximizing its value from an architectural perspective. You will ensure that the cloud environment aligns with the overall architectural vision and technical roadmap you have established.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Technical Roadmap Development**
	+ Create and Maintain a Technical Roadmap for the platform’s central services, ensuring that it supports the overall business plan.
	+ Alignment with Cloud Strategy: Ensure that the roadmap is in harmony with the organization’s cloud strategy and target architecture.
* **Platform Delivery and Operations**
	+ Drive Architecture Reviews: Facilitate reviews of architectural concepts and solutions to enhance platform performance, scalability, and reliability.
* **Leadership and Mentorship**
	+ In this role, you will be responsible for establishing and leading both local and global competence networks fostering knowledge sharing and innovation. However, your leadership will also involve taking actions when needed and making key decisions that guide Foundation Services toward meaningful outcomes
	+ Provide guidance and mentorship to Foundation Services Domain Architects, supporting their professional growth and helping them address technical challenges.
* **Engagement and Collaboration**
	+ As the Foundation Services Area Architect, your role requires strong engagement and collaboration across multiple levels of the organization and beyond with a focus on Foundation Services Domain teams.
**What we can offer you**
-------------------------

We show ownership and collectively take responsibility for the total delivery. Furthermore, we offer a solid benefits package, flexible work arrangements and possibilities to grow within the organization.

  

You will be part of a genuine and collaborative leadership team who work together towards a joint vision and targets. We learn to stay ahead and actively encourage competence development and acquisition of new skills.

  

We are located at Lindholmen Science Park in Gothenburg, in the heart of a vibrant area that lives and breathes innovation in areas of IoT, autonomous driving, connectivity and electromobility.

 **Your profile**


We are looking for someone with several years’ experience as a senior Architect, preferably in a global organization. We believe that you have experience in application operations and high availability infrastructure design, as well as agile software development. With a broad experience in cloud technologies and best practices, you will continue driving successful adoption of cloud services within our organization.

  

You are accustomed to making high impact technical decisions and executing against set targets. We also think that you strive to balance structure with creativity and dare to challenge the status quo when necessary to make room for innovations.

 **Your personality is a key driver of your success, but we also believe you possess the following qualities:**

* Several years of experience as an Architect in an international environment
* Ability to inspire and motivate stakeholders, individuals, and teams to work toward a common vision
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, enabling you to effectively express ideas and strategies. Clarifying complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong relationship-building skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between Business and Technology
* A global and agile mindset, paired with a strong customer focus that ensures solutions meet business needs
* Proven capability to drive and lead technical pre-studies for new initiatives, demonstrating strategic thinking
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, allowing seamless communication in diverse environments
* A valid work permit for Sweden, if you are not an EU citizen

  

Can you see yourself in the qualities described above? Do you see yourself taking on the role with the same focus on leadership, collaboration, and engagement? If so, please just apply! We are looking forward meeting you

**For any further questions and information**
---------------------------------------------

Please contact; Dora Palmai, Director Foundation Services, +46 739 023189

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

At **Volvo Group Connected Solutions** we drive transportation forward through connectivity. Our services and solutions are the key to a connected and more productive infrastructure, to ensure safer transport and reduced carbon emissions. By leveraging massive amounts of data from our customers connected assets, we are leading the way in a rapidly changing industry.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Product Manager – Shared Cloud Services
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.
To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
Hello, I am Jeny Larsson, and I serve as Head of Product Management at Tobii Dynavox. I am now seeking a Senior Product Manager that will join our Product Management team to lead the evolution of our Shared Cloud Services. You will drive key initiatives around aligning our web solutions, and our community platform, and also bring good understanding about privacy and security. As a key member of our Product Management organization, you will play a central part in shaping the future and setting the strategic direction of our Shared Cloud Services, while ensuring scalability, compliance and exceptional user experience.  

At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment that values continuous learning and personal growth. We welcome applicants of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences. We strive to build a team with high psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable taking risks, learning from failures, and sharing their ideas openly.  

Your days will be filled with:* Setting the strategic direction and communicate a clear vision for our shared cloud services.
* Defining short- and long-term product/service goals that align with the company objectives, ensuring scalability and a high standard of compliance regarding privacy and security.
* Prioritizing initiatives based on business impact and customer needs.
* Collaborating closely with cross-functional engineering teams to design and implement cloud-based solutions that meet requirements.
* Facilitating strong communication between technical and non-technical teams, acting as a bridge to ensure alignment on goals and deliverables.
* Continuously learn and stay up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices, actively sharing knowledge with team members.
* Championing the voice of the customer to ensure cloud products address key pain points such as accessibility.
  

We are looking for someone with:* Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experiences.
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in product management.
* Minimum two years experience managing internal infrastructure development
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Fluent in English language.
* Demonstrated ability to learn from failures and use them as opportunities for growth and improvement.
  

We value both experience and the lessons learned throughout your professional journey. While we appreciate several years of experience, we believe that what you have accomplished and the knowledge you have gained are of greater significance. We are interested in your ability to contribute effectively to our team, innovate, and drive results.  

We are committed to building a team with a high level of psychological safety, where everyone is encouraged to take risks, learn from failures, and innovate. We also recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Our team enjoys flexible work hours and a range of benefits to support personal well-being and family commitments.  

Next Step!
Please address your questions to mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.co and submit your resume or LinkedIn profile (in English only) through our website. We're looking forward to your application!  

Where we stand:  

We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.  

Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Enterprise Architect to Group CIO \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. At the same time, we take a long-term view when working with our customers and driving towards sustainable future.

Are you a Senior Solution Architect, Domain Architect or similar and wants to take the next step in your career? We are now looking for a new Enterprise Architects for the SEB Group´s Architecture team located in Stockholm.
**What you will be doing**

The technology, data and infrastructure landscape at SEB is undergoing a constant change and modernization with aim to take advantage of several different technologies for relevant workloads.
 As Enterprise Architect, you help shape and drive SEB’s strategic agenda towards digital world class services for SEB’s customers. Your main focus is to create and drive target architecture in line with business objectives to improve quality and time to market of change activities, primarily those with a significant IT impact. You will work broadly across all departments of SEB and support different stakeholders who are in need of your expertise. That means you will guide and support development activities – both on strategic and operative levels. You will also provide C-level strategic support, for example in due diligence processes.

The position will focus on our Information and Data architecture in the ambition to be a data driven enterprise.

Our enterprise architecture team works as a central function and interacts with most parts of the SEB Group enabling personal development, education, and growth. The team currently consists of experienced and dedicated professionals who are focusing on developing architecture and strategy across all divisions and client segments within SEB.
**Who we are looking for**
* You have broad knowledge of products, processes and current solutions as well as target architecture and solution concepts within different areas
* You have experience of organizational design, quality systems and design of operating models on enterprise scale.
* You have experience of driving modern digital development in an agile context and promote finding better ways of working, skills & workforce development, utilization rate of common solutions
* You have excellent networking and communication skills within both business and IT, combined with the ability to understand business needs and requirements and turn them into technical solutions while designing sustainable architecture concepts
* You have great leadership skills and an ability to handle complexity on a strategic level
* You are passionate about driving and accelerating change, while at the same time preserving robust systems
* You are result- and business oriented and take personal responsibility for creating and delivering high-value results
* It will be of great value if you have specific knowledge within cloud and/or modern data architecture. For the position, hands on experience in Data Mesh based architecture, Information modelling and technologies will be of great value.
* Furthermore, we think that you have excellent capabilities to engage people and build relationship. But the most important asset you have is your passion for the possibilities of new technique and your inner motivation to help more people discover the possibilities it provides.


**What we offer**

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Agile and modern ways of working



**Ready to join?**

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. Since we select candidates on an ongoing basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-10-31. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Katarina Pihl at katarina.pihl@seb.se
